cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 100 mi S of Tiburon, Haiti
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to move northward across Haiti/Cuba, then northwest over the Bahamas and parallel the Florida east coast before curving near the GA/SC coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: coast near east-central Florida, with closest coastal encounter to GA/SC coast thereafter

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Turks & Caicos, north-central Cuba; no U.S. watches yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning for Haiti, eastern Cuba, southeastern & central Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greater Antilles, Bahamas, Florida peninsula, and eventually Georgia–South Carolina coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–50 kt) possible late Friday into Saturday with a low (11%) chance of 50-kt gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Depending on exact track, onshore flow could push water 3–5 ft above normal tides along the Georgia coast, including the Savannah River entrance.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain possible, producing localized flooding near the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and potential river flooding affecting port logistics and ground transportation.
